intro: Aster underwoodii, commonly known as the underwood's aster, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowering stems are usually unbranched and can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters. Aster underwoodii plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in shaded or partially shaded environments.
